column4: Then Mo’av [Seed of my Father] rebelled against Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] after the death of Ach’av [father’s brother].

And Achazyah [Yehovah possesses] fell down through a lattice in his upper chamber that [was] in Shomron [watch mountain] , and was injured: and he sent messengers, and said unto them, Go, enquire of Ba’al-Z’vuv [lord of the flies] the god of ‘Ekron [Torn Up by the Roots] whether I shall recover of this disease.

But the angel of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said to Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah] the Tishbi [captivity] , Arise, go up to meet the messengers of the king of Shomron [watch mountain] , and say unto them, [Is it] not because [there is] not a God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] in Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God], [that] you 2f go to enquire of Ba’al-Z’vuv [lord of the flies] the god of ‘Ekron [Torn Up by the Roots]?
Now therefore thus says the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , you i shall not come down from that bed on which you i are gone up, but shall surely die. And Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah] departed.
And when the messengers turned back unto him, he said unto them, Why are you 2f now turned back?

And they said unto him, There came a man up to meet us, and said unto us, Go, turn again unto the king that sent you, and say unto him, Thus says the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate), [Is it] not because [there is] not a God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] in Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God], [that] you i send to enquire of Ba’al-Z’vuv [lord of the flies] the god of ‘Ekron [Torn Up by the Roots] ? therefore you i shall not come down from that bed on which you i are gone up, but shall surely die.
And he said unto them, What manner of man [was he] which came up to meet you, and told you these words?
And they answered him, [He was] an hairy man, and wearing with a belt of leather about his waist. And he said, It [is] Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah] the Tishbi [captivity].

Then the king sent unto him a captain of fifty with his fifty. And he went up to him: and, behold, he sat on the top of an hill. And he spoke unto him, you i man of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , the king has said, Come down.

And Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah] answered and said to the captain of fifty, If I [be] a man of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , then let fire come down from heaven, and consume you i and your i fifty. And there came down fire from heaven, and consumed him and his fifty.

Again also he sent unto him another captain of fifty with his fifty. And he answered and said unto him, O man of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , thus has the king said, Come down quickly.

And Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah] answered and said unto them, If I [be] a man of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , let fire come down from heaven, and consume you i and your i fifty. And the fire of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] came down from heaven, and consumed him and his fifty.

And he sent again a captain of the third fifty with his fifty. And the third captain of fifty went up, and came and fell on his knees before Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah] , and besought him, and said unto him, O man of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , I pray you i , let my life, and the life of these fifty your i servants, be precious in your i sight.
Behold, there came fire down from heaven, and burnt up the two captains of the former fifties with their fifties: therefore let my life now be precious in your i sight.

And the angel (messenger) of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said unto Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah] , Go down with him: be not afraid of him. And he arose, and went down with him unto the king.

And he said unto him, Thus says the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , Forasmuch as you i have sent messengers to enquire of Ba’al-Z’vuv [lord of the flies] the god of ‘Ekron [Torn Up by the Roots], [is it] not because [there is] no God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] in Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] to enquire of his word? therefore you i shall not come down off that bed on which you i are gone up, but shall surely die.

So he died according to the word of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) which Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah] had spoken. And Y’horam [Yehovah is exalted] reigned in his stead in the second year of Y’horam [Yehovah is exalted] the son of Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] king of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] ; because he had no son.
Now the rest of the acts of Achazyah [Yehovah possesses] which he did, [are] they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God]?

And it came to pass, when the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) would take up Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah] into heaven by a whirlwind, that Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah] went with Eli-sha [my God is salvation] from Gilgal [A Wheel, Rolling].

And Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah] said unto Eli-sha [my God is salvation] , Tarry here, I pray you i ; for the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) has sent me to Beit-El [House of God] . And Eli-sha [my God is salvation] said [unto him, As] the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) lives, and [as] your i soul lives, I will not leave you i . So they went down to Beit-El [House of God].

And the sons of the prophets that [were] at Beit-El [House of God] came forth to Eli-sha [my God is salvation] , and said unto him, Know you i that the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) will take away your i master from your i head to day? And he said, Yes, I know [it] ; hold you 2f your peace (say no more).

And Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah] said unto him, Eli-sha [my God is salvation] , wait here, I pray you i ; for the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) has sent me to Yericho [Its Moon] . And he said, [As] the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) lives, and [as] your i soul lives, I will not leave you i . So they came to Yericho [Its Moon].

And the sons of the prophets that [were] at Yericho [Its Moon] came to Eli-sha [my God is salvation] , and said unto him, Know you i that the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) will take away your i master from your i head to day? And he answered, Yes, I know [it] ; hold you 2f your peace.

And Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah] said unto him, Tarry here I pray you i ; for the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) has sent me to Yarden [Descender] . And he said, [As] the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) lives, and [as] your i soul lives, I will not leave you i . And they two went on.
And fifty men of the sons of the prophets went, and stood to view afar off: and they two stood by Yarden [Descender].

And Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah] took his Mantle (cloak; covering garment) (cloak) , and wrapped [it] together, and struck the waters, and they were divided to the right and left, so that they two went over on dry ground.

And it came to pass, when they were gone over, that Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah] said unto Eli-sha [my God is salvation] , Ask what I shall do for you i , before I be taken away from you i . And Eli-sha [my God is salvation] said, I pray you i , let a double portion of your i spirit be upon me.
And he said, you i have asked a hard thing: [nevertheless] , if you i see me [when I am] taken from you i , it shall be so unto you i ; but if not, it shall not be [so].

And it came to pass, as they still went on, and talked, that, behold, [there appeared] a chariot of fire, and horses of fire, and it separated them both; and Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah] went up by a whirlwind into heaven.

And Eli-sha [my God is salvation] saw [it] , and he cried, My father! my father! the chariot and the horsemen of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] ! And he lost sight of him: and he took hold of his own clothes, and tore them in two pieces.
He took up also the Mantle (cloak; covering garment) (cloak) of Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah] that fell from him, and went back, and stood by the bank of Yarden [Descender];

And he took the Mantle (cloak; covering garment) (cloak) of Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah] that fell from him, and struck the waters, and said, Where [is] the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah] ? and when he also had smitten the waters, they parted to the right and to the left: and Eli-sha [my God is salvation] went over.

And when the sons of the prophets which [were] to view at Yericho [Its Moon] saw him, they said, The spirit of Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah] does rest on Eli-sha [my God is salvation] . And they came to meet him, and bowed themselves to the ground before him.

And they said unto him, Behold now, there be with your i servants fifty strong men; let them go, we pray you i , and seek your i master: in the event perhaps the Spirit of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) has taken him up, and cast him upon some mountain, or into some valley. And he said, You 2f shall not send.
And when they urged him till he was ashamed, he said, Send. They sent therefore fifty men; and they sought three days, but found him not.
And when they came again to him, (for he tarried at Yericho [Its Moon] ,) he said unto them, Did I not say unto you, Go not?
And the men of the city said unto Eli-sha [my God is salvation] , Behold, I pray you i , the situation of this city [is] pleasant, as my lord sees: but the water [is] bad, and the ground barren.
And he said, Bring me a new jug, and put salt in it. And they brought [it] to him.

And he went forth unto the spring of the waters, and cast the salt in there, and said, Thus says the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , I have healed these waters; there shall not be from there any more death or barren [land].
So the waters were healed unto this day, according to the saying of Eli-sha [my God is salvation] which he spoke.

And he went up from there unto Beit-El [House of God] : and as he was going up by the way, there came forth young men out of the city, and mocked him, and said unto him, Go up, you i bald head; go up, you i bald head.

And he turned back, and looked on them, and cursed them in the name of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) . And there came forth two she bears out of the wood, and tare forty and two children of them.
And he went from there to mount Carmel [Garden-land] , and from there he returned to Shomron [watch mountain].

Now Y’horam [Yehovah is exalted] the son of Ach’av [father’s brother] began to reign over Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] in Shomron [watch mountain] the eighteenth year of Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] king of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] , and reigned twelve years.

And he wrought evil in the sight of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) ; but not like his father, and like his mother: for he put away the image of Ba’al [lord (a false god)] that his father had made.
Nevertheless he cleaved unto the sins of Yarov’am [the people will contend] the son of N’vat [aspect] , which made Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] to sin; he departed not from them.

And Mesha [deliverance] king of Mo’av [Seed of my Father] was a sheep-breeder, and rendered unto the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] an hundred thousand lambs, and an hundred thousand rams, with the wool.
But it came to pass, when Ach’av [father’s brother] was dead, that the king of Mo’av [Seed of my Father] rebelled against the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].
And king Y’horam [Yehovah is exalted] went out of Shomron [watch mountain] the same time, and numbered all Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].

And he went and sent to Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] the king of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] , saying, The king of Mo’av [Seed of my Father] has rebelled against me: will you i go with me against Mo’av [Seed of my Father] to battle? And he said, I will go up: I [am] as you i [are] , my people as your i people, [and] my horses as your i horses.
And he said, Which way shall we go up? And he answered, The way through the wilderness of Edom [Red].

So the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] went, and the king of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] , and the king of Edom [Red] : and they went on a circular course (go around, encircle; encompass) of seven days’ journey: and there was no water for the host, and for the cattle that followed them.

And the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] said, Alas! that the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) has called these three kings together, to deliver them into the hand of Mo’av [Seed of my Father]!

But Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] said, [Is there] not here a prophet of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , that we may enquire of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) by him? And one of the king of Yisra’el’s [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] servants answered and said, Here [is] Eli-sha [my God is salvation] the son of Shafat [He Has Judged] , which poured water on the hands of Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah].

And Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] said, The word of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) is with him. So the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] and Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] and the king of Edom [Red] went down to him.

And Eli-sha [my God is salvation] said unto the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , What have I to do with you i ? get you i to the prophets of your i father, and to the prophets of your i mother. And the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] said unto him, No: for the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) has called these three kings together, to deliver them into the hand of Mo’av [Seed of my Father].

And Eli-sha [my God is salvation] said, [As] the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) Tz’va’ot [of the Heavenly Armies] lives, before whom I stand, surely, were it not that I regard the presence of Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] the king of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] , I would not look toward you i , nor see you i.
But now bring me a musician. And it came to pass, when the musician played, that the hand of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) came upon him.
And he said, Thus says the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , Make this valley full of trenches.

For thus says the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , You 2f shall not see wind, neither shall you 2f see rain; yet that valley shall be filled with water, that you 2f may drink, both you 2f , and your cattle, and your beasts.
And this is [but] a light thing in the sight of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) : he will deliver the Mo’avi [of his father] also into your hand.
And you 2f shall strike every fenced city, and every choice city, and shall fell every good tree, and stop all wells of water, and ruin every good piece of land with stones.
And it came to pass in the morning, when the meat offering was offered, that, behold, there came water by the way of Edom [Red] , and the country was filled with water.
And when all the Mo’avi [of his father] heard that the kings were come up to fight against them, they gathered all that were able to put on armour, and upward, and stood in the border.
And they rose up early in the morning, and the sun shone upon the water, and the Mo’avi [of his father] saw the water on the other side [as] red as blood:
And they said, This [is] blood: the kings are surely slain, and they have smitten one another: now therefore, Mo’av [Seed of my Father] , to the spoil (plunder; prey; booty).

And when they came to the camp of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , the Yisra’eli’s rose up and struck the Mo’avi [of his father] , so that they fled before them: but they went forward attacking the Mo’avi [of his father] , even in [their] country.

And they beat down the cities, and on every good piece of land cast every man his stone, and filled it; and they stopped all the wells of water, and felled all the good trees: only in Kir-Hareset [wall of potsherds] left they the stones thereof; howbeit the slingers went about [it] , and struck it.

And when the king of Mo’av [Seed of my Father] saw that the battle was too much for him, he took with him seven hundred men that drew swords, to break through [even] unto the king of Edom [Red] : but they could not.

Then he took his eldest son that should have reigned in his stead, and offered him [for] a burnt offering upon the wall. And there was great indignation against Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] : and they departed from him, and returned to [their own] land.

Now there cried a certain woman of the wives of the sons of the prophets unto Eli-sha [my God is salvation] , saying, Your 1s servant my husband is dead; and you i know that your i servant did fear the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) : and the creditor is come to take with him my two sons to be slaves.

And Eli-sha [my God is salvation] said unto her, What shall I do for you i ? tell me, what have you i in the house? And she said, Your 1s female servant has not anything in the house, save a pot of oil.
Then he said, Go, borrow you i containers from all your i neighbours, [even] empty vessels; borrow not a few.
And when you i are come in, you i shall shut the door upon you i and upon your i sons, and shall pour out into all those vessels, and you i shall set aside that which is full.
So she went from him, and shut the door upon her and upon her sons, who brought [the vessels] to her; and she poured out.
And it came to pass, when the vessels were full, that she said unto her son, Bring me another vessel. And he said unto her, [There is] not a vessel more. And the oil stopped flowing.
Then she came and told the man of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] . And he said, Go, sell the oil, and pay your i debt, and live you i and your i children off the rest.

And it fell on a day, that Eli-sha [my God is salvation] passed to Shunem [Double Resting Place] , where [was] a well-to-do woman; and she constrained him to eat bread. And [so] it was, [that] as oft as he passed by, he turned in there to eat bread.
And she said unto her husband, Behold now, I perceive that this [is] an holy man of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , which passes by us continually.

Let us make a little chamber, I pray you i , on the wall; and let us set for him there a bed, and a table, and a stool, and a candlestick: and it shall be, when he comes to us, that he shall turn in there.
And it fell on a day, that he came there, and he turned into the chamber, and lay there.
And he said to Geichazi [valley of vision] his servant, Call this Shunamit [double resting place] . And when he had called her, she stood before him.

And he said unto him, Say now unto her, Behold, you i have shown us so much hospitality; what [is] to be done for you i ? would you i be spoken for to the king, or to the captain of the host? And she answered, I dwell among my own people.
And he said, What then [is] to be done for her? And Geichazi [valley of vision] answered, Truly she has no child, and her husband is old.
And he said, Call her. And when he had called her, she stood in the door.

And he said, About this season, according to the time of life, you i shall embrace a son. And she said, No, my lord, [you i ] man of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , do not lie unto your i female servant.
And the woman conceived, and bore a son at that season that Eli-sha [my God is salvation] had said unto her, according to the time of life.
And when the child was grown, it fell on a day, that he went out to his father to the reapers.
And he said unto his father, My head, my head. And he said to a boy, Carry him to his mother.
And when he had taken him, and brought him to his mother, he sat on her knees till noon, and [then] died.
And she went up, and laid him on the bed of the man of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , and shut [the door] upon him, and went out.

And she called unto her husband, and said, Send me, I pray you i , one of the young men, and one of the asses, that I may run to the man of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , and come again.
And he said, For what reason will you i go to him to day? [it is] neither new moon, nor Shabbat [Rest] . And she said, [It shall be] well (It will be alright).
Then she saddled an ass, and said to her servant, Drive, and go forward; slack not [your i ] riding for me, unless I say so to you i.

So she went and came unto the man of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] to mount Carmel [Garden-land] . And it came to pass, when the man of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] saw her afar off, that he said to Geichazi [valley of vision] his servant, Behold, [over there is] that Shunamit [double resting place]:
Run now, I pray you i , to meet her, and say unto her, [Is it] well with you i? [is it] well with you i husband? [is it] well with the child? And she answered, [It is] well.

And when she came to the man of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] to the hill, she caught him by the feet: but Geichazi [valley of vision] came near to thrust her away. And the man of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] said, Let her alone; for her soul [is] vexed within her: and the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) has hid [it] from me, and has not told me.
Then she said, Did I desire a son of my lord? did I not say, Do not deceive me?

Then he said to Geichazi [valley of vision] , Get dressed for action, and take my staff in your i hand, and go on your i way: if you i meet any man, salute him not; and if any salute you i , answer him not again: and lay my staff upon the face of the child.
And the mother of the child said, [As] the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) lives, and [as] yorui soul lives, I will not leave you i . And he arose, and followed her.

And Geichazi [valley of vision] passed on before them, and laid the staff upon the face of the child; but [there was] neither voice, nor hearing. For this reason he went again to meet him (Eli-sha) , and told him, saying, The child is not awakened.
And when Eli-sha [my God is salvation] was come into the house, behold, the child was dead, [and] laid upon his bed.
He went in therefore, and shut the door upon them both, and prayed unto the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).

And he went up, and lay upon the child, and put his mouth upon his mouth, and his eyes upon his eyes, and his hands upon his hands: and he stretched himself upon the child; and the flesh of the child grew warm.
Then he went down, and walked in the house to and fro; and went up, and stretched himself upon him: and the child sneezed seven times, and the child opened his eyes.
And he called Geichazi [valley of vision] , and said, Call this Shunamit [double resting place] . So he called her. And when she was come in unto him, he said, Take up your i son.
Then she went in, and fell at his feet, and bowed herself to the ground, and took up her son, and went out.

And Eli-sha [my God is salvation] came again to Gilgal [A Wheel, Rolling] : and [there was] a famine in the land; and the sons of the prophets [were] sitting before him: and he said unto his servant, Set on the great pot, and seethe pottage for the sons of the prophets.

And one went out into the field to gather herbs, and found a wild vine, and gathered thereof wild gourds his lap full, and came and shred [them] into the pot of pottage: they didn’t know what they were.

So they poured out for the men to eat. And it came to pass, as they were eating of the pottage, that they cried out, and said, O [you i ] man of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered], [there is] death in the pot. And they could not eat [of it].
But he said, Then bring flour. And he cast [it] into the pot; and he said, Pour out for the people, that they may eat. And there was nothing harmful in the pot.

And there came a man from Ba’al-Shalishah [thrice-great lord] , and brought the man of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] bread of the firstfruits, twenty loaves of barley, and full ears of corn in the husk thereof. And he said, Give unto the people, that they may eat.

And his servant said, How should I set this before an hundred men? He said again, Give the people, that they may eat: for thus says the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , They shall eat, and shall have some leftover of it.
So he set [it] before them, and they did eat, and had some left over, according to the word of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).

Now Na’aman [Pleasantness] , captain of the host of the king of Aram (Syria) [exalted] , was a great man with his master, and honourable, because by him the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) had given deliverance unto Aram (Syria) [exalted] : he was also a mighty man in valour, [but he was] a leper.

And the Aram [Syrians] had gone out by companies, and had brought away captive out of the land of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] a little maid; and she waited on Na’aman [Pleasantness] ’s wife.
And she said unto her mistress, Would God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] my lord [were] with the prophet that [is] in Shomron [watch mountain] ! for he would heal him of his leprosy.
And [one] went in, and told his lord, saying, Thus and thus said the maid that [is] of the land of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].

And the king of Aram (Syria) [exalted] said, Go ahead, go, and I will send a letter unto the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] . And he departed, and took with him ten talents of silver, and six thousand [pieces] of gold, and ten changes of clothing.

And he brought the letter to the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , saying, Now when this letter is come unto you i , behold, I have [along with it] sent Na’aman [Pleasantness] my servant to you i , that you i may heal him of his leprosy.

And it came to pass, when the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] had read the letter, that he rent his clothes, and said, [Am] I God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , to kill and to make alive, that this man does send unto me to heal a man of his leprosy? Therefore consider, I pray you, and see how he seeks a quarrel against me.

And it was [so] , when Eli-sha [my God is salvation] the man of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] had heard that the king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] had rent his clothes, that he sent to the king, saying, For what reason have you i rent your i clothes? let him come now to me, and he shall know that there is a prophet in Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].

(Now Yoram [Yehovah is exalted] had kept Ramot-Gil’ad [rocky region] , he and all Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , because of Haza’el [one who sees God] king of Aram (Syria) [exalted].

But king Yoram [Yehovah is exalted] was returned to be healed in Yizre’el [God Sows] of the wounds which the Aram [Syrians] had given him, when he fought with Haza’el [one who sees God] king of Aram (Syria) [exalted] .) And Yehu [Yehovah is He] said, If it be your minds, [then] let none go forth [nor] escape out of the city to go to tell [it] in Yizre’el [God Sows].

So Yehu [Yehovah is He] rode in a chariot, and went to Yizre’el [God Sows] ; for Yoram [Yehovah is exalted] lay there. And Achazyah [Yehovah possesses] king of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] was come down to see Yoram [Yehovah is exalted].

And there stood a watchman on the tower in Yizre’el [God Sows] , and he spied the company of Yehu [Yehovah is He] as he came, and said, I see a company. And Yoram [Yehovah is exalted] said, Take an horseman, and send to meet them, and let him say, [Do you come in] peace?

So there went one on horseback to meet him, and said, Thus says the king, [Is it] peace? And Yehu [Yehovah is He] said, What have you i to do with peace? turn you i behind me. And the watchman explained (to the king) , saying, The messenger came to them, but he comes not again.
Then he sent out a second on horseback, which came to them, and said, Thus says the king, [Is it] peace? And Yehu [Yehovah is He] answered, What have you i to do with peace? turn you i behind me.
And the watchman told, saying, He came even unto them, and comes not again: and the driving [is] like the driving of Yehu [Yehovah is He] the son of Nimshi [rescued] ; for he drives furiously.

And Yoram [Yehovah is exalted] said, Make ready. And his chariot was made ready. And Yoram [Yehovah is exalted] king of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] and Achazyah [Yehovah possesses] king of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] went out, each in his chariot, and they went out against Yehu [Yehovah is He] , and met him in the portion of Navot [fruits] the Yizre’eli [God Sows].

And it came to pass, when Yoram [Yehovah is exalted] saw Yehu [Yehovah is He] , that he said, [Is it] peace, Yehu [Yehovah is He] ? And he answered, What peace, so long as the cult prostitution of your i mother Izevel [Ba’al exalts] and her witchcrafts [are so] many?
And Yoram [Yehovah is exalted] turned his hands, and fled, and said to Achazyah [Yehovah possesses] , Treachery! O Achazyah [Yehovah possesses]!
And Yehu [Yehovah is He] drew a bow with his full strength, and struck Y’horam [Yehovah is exalted] between his arms, and the arrow went out at his heart, and he sunk down in his chariot.

Then said [Yehu [Yehovah is He]] to Bidkar [with a stab] his captain, Pick him up, [and] cast him in the portion of the field of Navot [fruits] the Yizre’eli [God Sows] : for remember how that, when I and you i rode together after Ach’av [father’s brother] his father, the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) pronounced this sentence upon him;

Surely I have seen yesterday the blood of Navot [fruits] , and the blood of his sons, says the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) ; and I will pay you i back in this field, says the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) . Now therefore take [and] cast him into the field [of ground] , according to the word of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).

But when Achazyah [Yehovah possesses] the king of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] saw [this] , he fled by the way of the garden house. And Yehu [Yehovah is He] followed after him, and said, Strike him also in the chariot. [And they did so] at the going up to Gur [sojourning] , which [is] by Yivle’am [Devouring the People] . And he fled to Megiddo [Place of Crowds] , and died there.
And his servants carried him in a chariot to Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] , and buried him in his sepulcher with his fathers in the city of David [beloved].
And in the eleventh year of Yoram [Yehovah is exalted] the son of Ach’av [father’s brother] began Achazyah [Yehovah possesses] to reign over Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised].
And when Yehu [Yehovah is He] was come to Yizre’el [God Sows] , Izevel [Ba’al exalts] heard [of it] ; and she painted her face, and fixed her hair, and looked out the window.
And as Yehu [Yehovah is He] entered in at the gate, she said, [Are you here in] peace Zimri [My Music] ? who murdered his master?
And he lifted up his face to the window, and said, Who [is] on my side? who? And there looked out to him two [or] three eunuchs.
And he said, Throw her down. So they threw her down: and [some] of her blood was sprinkled on the wall, and on the horses: and he trampled her under foot.
And when he was come in, he did eat and drink, and said, Go, see now this cursed [woman] , and bury her: for she [is] a king’s daughter.
And they went to bury her: but they found no more of her than the skull, and the feet, and the palms of [her] hands.

For this reason they came again, and told him. And he said, This [is] the word of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , which he spoke by his servant Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah] the Tishbi [captivity] , saying, In the portion of Yizre’el [God Sows] shall dogs eat the flesh of Izevel [Ba’al exalts]:
And the carcass of Izevel [Ba’al exalts] shall be as dung upon the face of the field in the portion of Yizre’el [God Sows]; [so] that they shall not say, This [is] Izevel [Ba’al exalts].

And Ach’av [father’s brother] had seventy sons in Shomron [watch mountain] . And Yehu [Yehovah is He] wrote letters, and sent to Shomron [watch mountain] , unto the rulers of Yizre’el [God Sows] , to the elders, and to them that brought up Ach’av’s [father’s brother] [children] , saying,
Now as soon as this letter comes to you, seeing your master’s sons [are] with you, and [there are] with you chariots and horses, a fenced city also, and armour;
Look even out the best and most suitable of your master’s sons, and set [him] on his father’s throne, and fight for your master’s house.
But they were exceedingly afraid, and said, Behold, two kings stood not before him: how then shall we stand?

And he that [was] over the house, and he that [was] over the city, the elders also, and the bringers up [of the children] , sent to Yehu [Yehovah is He] , saying, We [are] your i servants, and will do all that you i shall bid us; we will not make any king: do you i [that which is] good in your i eyes.

Then he wrote a letter the second time to them, saying, If you 2f [be] mine, and [if] you 2f will hearken unto my voice, take you 2f the heads of the men your master’s sons, and come to me to Yizre’el [God Sows] by tomorrow this time. Now the king’s sons, [being] seventy persons, [were] with the great men of the city, which brought them up.
And it came to pass, when the letter came to them, that they took the king’s sons, and killed seventy persons, and put their heads in baskets, and sent him [them] to Yizre’el [God Sows].
And there came a messenger, and told him, saying, They have brought the heads of the king’s sons. And he said, Lay you 2f them in two heaps at the entering in of the gate until the morning.
And it came to pass in the morning, that he went out, and stood, and said to all the people, You 2f [be] righteous: behold, I conspired against my master, and killed him: but who killed all these?

Know now that there shall fall unto the earth nothing of the word of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , which the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) spoke concerning the house of Ach’av [father’s brother] : for the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) has done [that] which he spoke by his servant Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah].

So Yehu [Yehovah is He] killed all that remained of the house of Ach’av [father’s brother] in Yizre’el [God Sows] , and all his great men, and his relatives, and his priests, until he left him none remaining.
And he arose and departed, and came to Shomron [watch mountain]. [And] as he [was] at the shearing house in the way,

Yehu [Yehovah is He] met with the brethren of Achazyah [Yehovah possesses] king of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] , and said, Who [are] you 2f ? And they answered, We [are] the brethren of Achazyah [Yehovah possesses] ; and we go down to salute the children of the king and the children of the queen.
And he said, Take them alive. And they took them alive, and killed them at the pit of the shearing house, [even] two and forty men; neither left he any of them [alive].

And when he was departed there, he lighted on Y’honadav [Yehovah is willing] the son of Rekhav [rider] [coming] to meet him: and he saluted him, and said to him, Is your i heart right, as my heart [is] with your i heart? And Y’honadav [Yehovah is willing] answered, It is. If it be, give [me] your i hand. And he gave [him] his hand; and he took him up to him into the chariot.
And he said, Come with me, and see my zeal for the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) . So they made him ride in his chariot.

And when he came to Shomron [watch mountain] , he killed all that remained unto Ach’av [father’s brother] in Shomron [watch mountain] , till he had destroyed him, according to the saying of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , which he spoke to Eliyahu [my God is Yehovah].
And Yehu [Yehovah is He] gathered all the people together, and said unto them, Ach’av [father’s brother] served Ba’al [lord (a false god)] a little; [but] Yehu [Yehovah is He] shall serve him much.

Now therefore call unto me all the prophets of Ba’al [lord (a false god)] , all his servants, and all his priests; let none be wanting: for I have a great sacrifice [to do] to Ba’al [lord (a false god)] ; whosoever shall be wanting, he shall not live. But Yehu [Yehovah is He] did [it] in subtlety, to the intent that he might destroy the worshippers of Ba’al [lord (a false god)].
And Yehu [Yehovah is He] said, Proclaim a solemn assembly for Ba’al [lord (a false god)] . And they proclaimed [it].

And Yehu [Yehovah is He] sent through all Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] : and all the worshippers of Ba’al [lord (a false god)] came, so that there was not a man left that came not. And they came into the house of Ba’al [lord (a false god)] ; and the house of Ba’al [lord (a false god)] was full from one end to another.
And he said unto him that [was] over the wardrobe, Bring forth robes for all the worshippers of Ba’al [lord (a false god)] . And he brought them forth robes.

And Yehu [Yehovah is He] went, and Y’honadav [Yehovah is willing] the son of Rekhav [rider] , into the house of Ba’al [lord (a false god)] , and said unto the worshippers of Ba’al [lord (a false god)] , Search, and look that there be here with you none of the servants of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , but the worshippers of Ba’al [lord (a false god)] only.

And when they went in to offer sacrifices and burnt offerings, Yehu [Yehovah is He] appointed eighty men without, and said, [If] any of the men whom I have brought into your hands escape, [he that lets him go] , his life [shall be] for the life of him.

And it came to pass, as soon as he had made an end of offering the burnt offering, that Yehu [Yehovah is He] said to the guard and to the captains, Go in, [and] slay them; let none come forth. And they struck them with the edge of the sword; and the guard and the captains cast [them] out, and went to the city of the house of Ba’al [lord (a false god)].
And they brought forth the images out of the house of Ba’al [lord (a false god)] , and burned them.
And they broke down the image of Ba’al [lord (a false god)] , and broke down the house of Ba’al [lord (a false god)] , and made it a latrine unto this day.
Thus Yehu [Yehovah is He] destroyed Ba’al [lord (a false god)] out of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].

However [from] the sins of Yarov’am [the people will contend] the son of N’vat [aspect] , who made Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] to sin, Yehu [Yehovah is He] departed not from after them, [that is to say] , the golden calves that [were] in Beit-El [House of God] , and that [were] in Dan [Judge].

And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said unto Yehu [Yehovah is He] , Because you i have done well in executing [that which is] right in my eyes, [and] have done unto the house of Ach’av [father’s brother] according to all that [was] in my heart, your i children of the fourth [generation] shall sit on the throne of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].

But Yehu [Yehovah is He] took no heed to walk in the law of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] with all his heart: for he departed not from the sins of Yarov’am [the people will contend] , which made Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] to sin.

In those days the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) began to cut Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] short: and Haza’el [one who sees God] struck them in all the coasts of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God];

From Yarden [Descender] eastward, all the land of Gil’ad [Rocky Region] , the Gadi [my fortune] [A Troop] , and the Re’uveni [behold, a son!] , and the M’nasheh [Causing to Forget] , from ‘Aeo’er [Ruins] , which [is] by the river ‘Arnon [Rushing Stream] , even Gil’ad [Rocky Region] and Bashan [Fruitful].

Now the rest of the acts of Yehu [Yehovah is He] , and all that he did, and all his might, [are] they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God]?
And Yehu [Yehovah is He] slept with his fathers: and they buried him in Shomron [watch mountain] . And Y’ho’achaz [Yehovah has seized] his son reigned in his stead.
And the time that Yehu [Yehovah is He] reigned over Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] in Shomron [watch mountain] [was] twenty and eight years.
And when ‘Atalyahu [afflicted of the Lord] the mother of Achazyah [Yehovah possesses] saw that her son was dead, she arose and destroyed all the seed royal.

But Y’hosheva [Yehovah has sworn] , the daughter of king Yoram [Yehovah is exalted] , sister of Achazyah [Yehovah possesses] , took Yo’ash [Given by the Lord] the son of Achazyah [Yehovah possesses] , and stole him from among the king’s sons [which were] slain; and they hid him, [even] him and his nurse, in the bedchamber from ‘Atalyahu [afflicted of the Lord] , so that he was not slain.
And he was with her hid in the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) six years. And ‘Atalyahu [afflicted of the Lord] did reign over the land.

And the seventh year Y’hoyada [Yehovah knows] sent and fetched the rulers over hundreds, with the captains and the guard, and brought them to him into the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , and made a covenant with them, and took an oath of them in the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , and showed them the king’s son.
And he commanded them, saying, This [is] the thing that you 2f shall do; A tles hird part of you that enter in on the Shabbat [Rest] shall even be keepers of the watch of the king’s house;
And a third part [shall be] at the gate of Sur [turning aside] ; and a third part at the gate behind the guard: so shall you 2f keep the watch of the house, that it be not broken down.
And two parts of all you that go forth on the Shabbat [Rest] , even they shall keep the watch of the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) about the king.

And you 2f shall compass (go around, encircle; encompass) the king round about, every man with his weapons in his hand: and he that comes within the ranges, let him be slain: and be you 2f with the king as he goes out and as he comes in.

And the captains over the hundreds did according to all [things] that Y’hoyada [Yehovah knows] the priest commanded: and they took every man his men that were to come in on the Shabbat [Rest] , with them that should go out on the Shabbat [Rest] , and came to Y’hoyada [Yehovah knows] the priest.
And to the captains over hundreds did the priest give king David’s [beloved] ’s spears and shields, that [were] in the temple of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).
And the guard stood, every man with his weapons in his hand, round about the king, from the right corner of the temple to the left corner of the temple, [along] by the altar and the temple.
And he brought forth the king’s son, and put the crown upon him, and [gave him] the testimony; and they made him king, and anointed him; and they clapped their hands, and said, Long live the king!
And when ‘Atalyahu [afflicted of the Lord] heard the noise of the guard [and] of the people, she came to the people into the temple of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).

And when she looked, behold, the king stood by a pillar, as the custom [was] , and the princes and the trumpeters by the king, and all the people of the land rejoiced, and blew with trumpets: and ‘Atalyahu [afflicted of the Lord] rent her clothes, and cried, Treason, Treason!

But Y’hoyada [Yehovah knows] the priest commanded the captains of the hundreds, the officers of the host, and said unto them, Bring her forth out past the ranks [of guards] : and him that follows her kill with the sword. For the priest had said, Let her not be slain in the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).
And they laid hands on her; and she went by the way by the which the horses came into the king’s house: and there was she slain.

And Y’hoyada [Yehovah knows] made a covenant between the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) and the king and the people, that they should be the Lord-Yehōvah’s [Messiah Pre-Incarnate] people; between the king also and the people.

And all the people of the land went into the house of Ba’al [lord (a false god)] , and broke it down; his altars and his images broke they in pieces thoroughly, and killed Mattan [a gift] the priest of Ba’al [lord (a false god)] before the altars. And the priest appointed officers over the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).

And he took the rulers over hundreds, and the captains, and the guard, and all the people of the land; and they brought down the king from the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , and came by the way of the gate of the guard to the king’s house. And he sat on the throne of the kings.
And all the people of the land rejoiced, and the city was in quiet: and they killed ‘Atalyahu [afflicted of the Lord] with the sword [beside] the king’s house.
Seven years old [was] Y’ho’ash [given by the Lord] when he began to reign.

In the seventh year of Yehu [Yehovah is He] Y’ho’ash [given by the Lord] began to reign; and forty years reigned he in Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] . And his mother’s name [was] Tzivyah [roe] of Be’er-sheva [Well of the sevenfold Oath].
And Y’ho’ash [given by the Lord] did [that which was] right in the sight of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) all his days wherein Y’hoyada [Yehovah knows] the priest instructed him.
But the high places were not taken away: the people still sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places.

And Y’ho’ash [given by the Lord] said to the priests, All the money of the dedicated things that is brought into the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate), [even] the money of everyone that passes [the account] , the money that every man is set at, [and] all the money that comes into any man’s heart to bring into the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate),
Let the priests take [it] to them, every man of his acquaintance: and let them repair the breaches of the house, wherever any breach (breaking forth; a break; opening, inlet) shall be found.
But it was [so, that] in the three and twentieth year of king Y’ho’ash [given by the Lord] the priests had not repaired the breaches of the house.

Then king Y’ho’ash [given by the Lord] called for Y’hoyada [Yehovah knows] the priest, and the [other] priests, and said unto them, Why repair you 2f not the breaches of the house? now therefore receive no [more] money of those who contribute personally to you, but deliver it for the breaches of the house.
And the priests consented to receive no [more] money of the people, neither to repair the breaches of the house.

But Y’hoyada [Yehovah knows] the priest took a chest, and bored a hole in the lid of it, and set it beside the altar, on the right side as one comes into the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) : and the priests that kept the door put in it all the money [that was] brought into the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).

And it was [so] , when they saw that [there was] much money in the chest, that the king’s scribe and the High Priest came up, and they put up in bags, and told the money that was found in the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).

And they gave the money, being told, into the hands of them that did the work, that had the oversight of the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) : and they laid it out to the carpenters and builders, that worked upon the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate),

And to masons, and hewers of stone, and to buy timber and hewed stone to repair the breaches of the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , and for all that was laid out for the house to repair [it].

However there were not made for the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) bowls of silver, snuffers, basons, trumpets, any vessels of gold, or vessels of silver, of the money [that was] brought into the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate):
But they gave that to the workmen, and repaired with that the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).
Moreover they did not require and accounting with the men, into whose hand they delivered the money to be given to the workmen: for they dealt honestly.
The trespass money and sin money was not brought into the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) : it belonged to the priests’.

Then Haza’el [one who sees God] king of Aram (Syria) [exalted] went up, and fought against Gat [Winepress] , and took it: and Haza’el [one who sees God] set his face to go up to Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace].

And Y’ho’ash [given by the Lord] king of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] took all the consecrated things that Y’hoshafat [Yehovah has judged] , and Y’horam [Yehovah is exalted] , and Achazyah [Yehovah possesses] , his fathers, kings of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] , had dedicated, and his own consecrated things, and all the gold [that was] found in the treasures of the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , and in the king’s house, and sent [it] to Haza’el [one who sees God] king of Aram (Syria) [exalted] : and he went away from Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace].
And the rest of the acts of Yo’ash [Given by the Lord] , and all that he did, [are] they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised]?

And his servants arose, and made a conspiracy, and killed Yo’ash [Given by the Lord] in the Beit-Millo [fortification (defensive structure) or mound] [House of the Fortification (defensive structure)] , which goes down to Sila [a highway].

For Yozakhar [Yehovah remembers] the son of Shim’at [report] , and Y’hozavad [Yehovah has endowed] the son of Shomer [keeper] , his servants, struck him, and he died; and they buried him with his fathers in the city of David [beloved] : and Amatzyah [Yehovah is mighty] his son reigned in his stead.

In the three and twentieth year of Yo’ash [Given by the Lord] the son of Achazyah [Yehovah possesses] king of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] Y’ho’achaz [Yehovah has seized] the son of Yehu [Yehovah is He] began to reign over Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] in Shomron [watch mountain], [and reigned] seventeen years.

And he did [that which was] evil in the sight of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , and followed the sins of Yarov’am [the people will contend] the son of N’vat [aspect] , which made Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] to sin; he departed not from them.

And the anger of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) was kindled against Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , and he delivered them into the hand of Haza’el [one who sees God] king of Aram (Syria) [exalted] , and into the hand of Ben-Hadad [son of the (false god) Hadad] the son of Haza’el [one who sees God] , all [their] days.

And Y’ho’achaz [Yehovah has seized] besought the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , and the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) listened unto him: for he saw the oppression of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , because the king of Aram (Syria) [exalted] oppressed them.

(And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) gave Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] a saviour, so that they went out from under the hand of the Aram [Syrians] : and the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] dwelt in their tents, as formerly.

Nevertheless they departed not from the sins of the house of Yarov’am [the people will contend] , who made Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] sin, [but] walked in it: and there remained the grove also in Shomron [watch mountain] .)

Neither did he leave of the people to Y’ho’achaz [Yehovah has seized] but only fifty horsemen, and ten chariots, and ten thousand footmen; for the king of Aram (Syria) [exalted] had destroyed them, and had made them like the dust by threshing.

Now the rest of the acts of Y’ho’achaz [Yehovah has seized] , and all that he did, and his might, [are] they not written in the book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God]?
And Y’ho’achaz [Yehovah has seized] slept with his fathers; and they buried him in Shomron [watch mountain] : and Yo’ash [Given by the Lord] his son reigned in his place.
